cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Turks and Caicos and the Bahamas, then bending toward the Florida Keys and South Florida before turning northward inland up the peninsula

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including Lake Okeechobee, the Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Florida at this advisory (warnings confined to Hispaniola and the Bahamas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coastline from Jupiter Inlet through Miami, including Palm Beach County, with impacts expanding northward along the east coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (90% chance) with a 65% chance of hurricane-force gusts beginning late Saturday night and peaking Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 5–10 ft of inundation possible from Jupiter Inlet southward which includes Palm Beach County.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated amounts to 20 inches possible across southeast Florida, producing flash-flood potential at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering surf, dangerous rip currents, and possible coastal erosion that could affect berth structures and channel approaches.
